name: RTHM
headline: Simplifying complex illness care at scale
description:
Current Description: RTHM provides virtual-first care for complex illness including Long COVID, ME/CFS, POTS, and mast cell activation.  Many clinics focus on teaching patients how to better cope with symptoms, which is helpful, but we don’t stop there.  We develop collaborations & partnerships so our patients access to the most promising testing and root-cause directed early therapies for their illness(es) with the goal of simplifying and streamlining the most efficient and effective clinical pathways so they can be scaled in the form of low cost online modules overseen remotely by clinicians.  

In conjunction with clinical care, RTHM operates a clinical lab and collects deep molecular data with robust clinical context to develop AI-powered diagnostics and better ways of predicting which treatments may work best for whom.
tags: industry:consumer-health-services; industry:health-tech; industry:digital-health; industry:healthcare; industry:telemedicine; location:san-francisco-bay-area

founders.name: Ryan Kellogg, Founder
founders.description: Dr. Kellogg’s struggle with a mystery illness led him to pioneer technology for measuring thousands of molecules in self-collected blood microsamples. This allows for a better understanding of health fluctuations and the impacts of health interventions in detail. When combined with wearable sensors and symptom tracking, this technology allows for real-time health monitoring and pattern discovery with unprecedented resolution. PhD in Microfluidics and Systems Biology from ETH Zurich.

founders.name: Jennifer Curtin, Founder
founders.description: Physician treating post-viral illnesses & ME/CFS for >5 yrs, Long COVID for the past year.  Member of the ME/CFS Clinician Coalition & co-author of the latest Coalition ME/CFS expert management guidance published in Mayo Clinic Proceedings 8/25/2021.  Streamlined/mapped the complex decision making, testing & treatment logic for Long COVID & frequently diagnosed co-morbid illnesses (incl ME/CFS) so it can be more rapidly utilized by new healthcare providers and scaled.

# Simplifying Care For Complex Illness
RTHM connects patients to a comprehensive set of treatments, labs, and guidance for complex illnesses like Long COVID, ME/CFS, MCAS and POTS.
![Optimistic woman looking into the distance, symbolizing hope and recovery at our Long-Covid Clinic](https://rthm.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/headshot.png)
## Your health, your RTHM.
Care for complex illnesses needs to be highly personalized. We provide our patients with tools and expertise to deeply understand their health to shorten the path to effective treatments 
## Your health, your RTHM.
Care for complex illnesses needs to be highly personalized. We provide our patients with tools and expertise to deeply understand their health to shorten the path to effective treatments 
New
###  ![Direct Logo](https://rthm.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/10/rthm-direct-1.svg)
Our most accessible offering, empowering patients with access to hard to find treatments and tools to assist their journey back to health.
RTHM Direct Offers:
  * Starting at $49 per online assessment
  * No visits required
  * Treatments available as soon as 1 business day
  * Access to limited selection of low-risk treatments
  * Available states: California, Colorado, Florida, Illinois, Maryland, Massachusetts, New York, North Carolina, Ohio, Oregon, Texas, Virginia, Washington. More states to come. If you would like to see your state added, please let us know [here](https://www.rthm.com/<https:/rthm.feedbear.com/boards/new-states>).

[Get Started](https://www.rthm.com/<https:/direct.rthm.com>)
###  ![Direct Logo](https://rthm.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/10/rthm-clinic-1.svg)
Our premium concierge membership that includes multiple clinician visits, case reviews and broad access to extensive labs/therapies. Dive deep in your health condition with an expert clinician.
RTHM Clinic Offers:
  * Thorough medical record evaluation
  * Comprehensive laboratory ordering of over 300 biomarkers
  * Up to 12 expert clinician telehealth visits a year and panel reviews
  * Health advising appointments and care navigation
  * Access to broad set of treatments
  * Available states: California, Colorado, Washington, Oregon, New York and Texas

[Learn More](https://www.rthm.com/</clinic/>)
## We treat:
  * [ Dysautonomia ](https://www.rthm.com/<https:/rthm.com/articles/what-is-dysautonomia/>)
  * [ Latent Virus Reactivation ](https://www.rthm.com/<https:/rthm.com/articles/viral-reactivation-and-long-covid/>)
  * [ Endocrine & Metabolic Dysfunction ](https://www.rthm.com/<https:/rthm.com/articles/long-covid-endocrine-and-metabolic-issues/>)
  * [ Mast Cell Activation ](https://www.rthm.com/<https:/rthm.com/articles/mast-cell-activation-syndrome-mcas/>)
  * [ Brain Fog & Cognitive Dysfunction ](https://www.rthm.com/<https:/rthm.com/articles/what-is-brain-fog-and-cognitive-dysfunction-in-long-covid/>)
  * [ Neuropathies ](https://www.rthm.com/<https:/rthm.com/articles/long-covid-neuropathies/>)
  * [ Connective Tissue Disorders ](https://www.rthm.com/<https:/rthm.com/articles/connective-tissue-and-structural-disorders/>)
  * [ SARS-CoV-2 Viral Persistence ](https://www.rthm.com/<https:/rthm.com/articles/long-covid-the-theory-of-viral-persistence/>)
  * [ Chemosensory Disorders ](https://www.rthm.com/<https:/rthm.com/articles/how-does-covid-contribute-to-chemosensory-disorders/>)
  * [ Coagulopathy and Microclots ](https://www.rthm.com/<https:/rthm.com/articles/long-covid-coagulopathies-and-microclots/>)
  * [ ME/CFS ](https://www.rthm.com/<https:/rthm.com/articles/what-is-myalgic-encephalomyelitis-chronic-fatigue-syndrome-me-cfs/>)
  * [ Sleep and Circadian Disorders ](https://www.rthm.com/<https:/rthm.com/articles/long-covid-sleep-changes-and-disturbances/>)
  * [ Autoimmunity & Immune Dysregulation ](https://www.rthm.com/<https:/rthm.com/articles/autoimmunity-and-immune-dysregulation-in-long-covid/>)
  * [ Dysbiosis and GI Dysmotility ](https://www.rthm.com/<https:/rthm.com/articles/gastrointestinal-symptoms-seen-with-long-covid/>)
  * [ Migraines and Headaches ](https://www.rthm.com/<https:/rthm.com/articles/long-covid-migraines-and-headaches/>)


RTHM has given me hope. After struggling with long covid for two years, even with the help of a local long COVID clinic, I was still doing all of my own research and trying to keep my doctors advised of the state of the art in treatments."
Stuart S.
There is a reason I tell everyone suffering from long COVID that the most important thing they need to do is get in touch with RTHM: because I believe RTHM gave me my life back.”
John K.
When I think of my RTHM experience, I feel as if I have a personal advocate in the leading edge of Long COVID understanding and treatments. The breadth and reach of my RTHM team's knowledge and research for Long COVID medicines, treatments, concepts and their ability to get them across to me is awesome." 
Tom M.
I highly recommend RTHM…Dr Curtin and her team have gone above and beyond to pour through my 100s of records - labs, scans, reports and consult summaries.”
Ann M.
I went from being plagued by fatigue and PEM and unable to work to (and quite miserable about it all!) to being able to do my job, be engaged with my family life instead of moping in bed, and even starting to exercise again (but man am I deconditioned).”
John K.

View slide 1View slide 2View slide 3View slide 4View slide 5
## Our Approach
### Patients as partners
We listen and work collaboratively with you in your care. Every symptom and treatment tried by a patient provides clues in their journey to getting back to health. That is why we aggregate our patients' experiences and deploy the learnings through our treatment pathways. At RTHM, you benefit from the latest medical research and from the experience of other patients similar to you. We leverage the latest science and the data from all of our patients to find the most effective treatment course in the least amount of time.
![what do you mean, my labs were normal?](https://rthm.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/04/what-do-you-mean-my-labs-were-normal.png)
### Discover what works
A shorter path to effective treatment: in complex illness there are often several underlying health issues that need to be addressed using multiple treatments. We learn from what has worked from patients similar to you to efficiently find the best combination of treatments for you. We then measure your response to each treatment through vitals, labs and surveys and iterate until we find what works for you.
![The screens from the RTHM patient app that allows tracking of diets, treatments and symptoms on daily basis.](https://rthm.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/05/app-screenshots.png)
### Advancing science
Complex illnesses such as Long COVID & ME/CFS are so challenging to treat because the mechanisms causing them are still being determined. Additionally, not every patient is the same. Through our partnership with patients and research labs, we aim to advance science through discovering biomarkers to better understand, diagnose, and treat these illnesses.
![patients as partners, a woman consulting her doctor via virtual meeting.](https://rthm.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/04/patients-as-partners.png)
![Dr. Curtin, experienced ME/CFS physician and Long-Covid expert, gazing into the distance, symbolizing her personal journey and commitment to helping Long-Covid patients at our clinic.](https://rthm.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/headshot-1.jpg) ![Confident and smiling Dr. Kellogg, Stanford University scientist and pioneer in molecular profiling technology, symbolizing advancement in real-time health monitoring for complex illnesses at our clinic.](https://rthm.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/headshot-2.jpg) ![Dr. Snyder, head of Stanford's Healthcare Innovation Lab and pioneer in wearable technology for health tracking, looking confident, symbolizing his dedication to predicting and detecting disease changes at RTHM clinic](https://rthm.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/headshot-3.jpg)
## It’s personal for us.
### The RTHM founding team has worked for over a decade in the lab and in the clinic understanding and treating complex and post-infectious illness - because we are patients ourselves.
[Meet the team](https://www.rthm.com/<https:/rthm.com/team/>)
[ ![](https://rthm.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/04/Stat.svg) ](https://www.rthm.com/<https:/www.statnews.com/2023/03/07/blood-test-home-stanford-theranos-snyder/>) [ ![](https://rthm.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/04/Atlantic.svg) ](https://www.rthm.com/<https:/www.theatlantic.com/health/archive/2022/09/mecfs-chronic-fatigue-syndrome-doctors-long-covid/671518/>) [ ![](https://rthm.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/04/USA-Today.svg) ](https://www.rthm.com/<https:/www.usatoday.com/story/news/health/2023/01/19/stanford-michael-snyder-microsample-blood-health-insights/11076042002/>) [ ![](https://rthm.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/04/Popular-Science.svg) ](https://www.rthm.com/<https:/www.popsci.com/health/long-covid-care-chronic-illness/>) [ ![](https://rthm.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/09/NPR-Symbol-1-2.png) ](https://www.rthm.com/<https:/www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2023/09/09/1198342040/long-covid-causes-treatment-research>)

[ ![](https://rthm.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/twitter-footer.svg) ](https://www.rthm.com/<https:/twitter.com/RTHM_Health>) [ ![](https://rthm.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/facebook-footer.svg) ](https://www.rthm.com/<https:/www.facebook.com/HealthRTHM>) [ ![](https://rthm.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/instagram-footer.svg) ](https://www.rthm.com/<https:/www.instagram.com/rthm_health/>) [ ![](https://rthm.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/05/Youtube.svg) ](https://www.rthm.com/<https:/www.youtube.com/@RTHM_Health>)
### Real Time Health Monitoring.
RTHM integrates remote clinical medicine and research with advanced molecular and digital measurement technologies to bring new diagnostics and treatments to patients faster, starting with Long COVID.

## References

generated_description:
**Company Overview: RTHM**

Founded in 2018 and hailing from Redwood City, CA, RTHM is revolutionizing the way we approach complex illness care. Part of Y Combinator's Batch W22, this innovative health tech startup is on a mission to "simplify complex illness care at scale," addressing challenging conditions like Long COVID, ME/CFS, POTS, and mast cell activation syndrome.

**What They Do:**

RTHM is not just another telemedicine service. Unlike traditional clinics that merely help patients manage their symptoms, RTHM dives deep into the underlying issues. They partner with advanced clinical labs and develop AI-powered diagnostics, which facilitate a comprehensive understanding of each patient's unique health landscape. This allows for personalized and root-cause-directed therapies.

Their services include:
- **RTHM Direct**: A more accessible offering that starts at $49 for online assessments. Patients can access treatments within a business day without needing in-person visits.
- **RTHM Clinic**: A premium membership providing extensive lab access and multiple clinician visits throughout the year for a more hands-on approach to treatment.

**Approach and Innovation:**

At RTHM, the focus is on patient collaboration. They enrich their treatment pathways by learning from the experiences of patients, which helps refine their methods continually. Their integration of remote clinical medicine with advanced molecular data allows them to deliver cutting-edge solutions faster.

With a dedicated team of 14 employees, RTHM emphasizes building personalized care pathways. Their goal is to aggregate patient experiences into a broad repository of knowledge that can shorten treatment timelines and enhance outcomes.

**Why It Matters:**

In an era when healthcare can often feel impersonal, RTHM stands out by reinforcing the notion that care should be tailored to the individual's needs. Their insight into complex illnesses is grounded not just in clinical expertise but also in a real understanding of patient journeys—they're driven by their own past experiences in the field.

**Current Offerings and Future Goals:**

RTHM has plans to expand its services further across the United States to reach more patients who need help navigating these complex conditions. By leveraging their existing partnerships and clinical infrastructure, they're set to make significant strides in how chronic diseases are diagnosed and treated.

To learn more, visit their website at [RTHM](https://www.rthm.com). Whether you're wrestling with a complex illness or advocating for someone who is, RTHM aims to be a beacon of hope and a guide on the path to recovery.
